title: Evan Rachel Wood goes on a Twitter rant against the Academy
text:
She's always been one to speak her mind on social media and beyond, and Wednesday was no exception.

Evan Rachel Wood, actress of Westworld and Thirteen fame, took to Twitter that afternoon to express some of her views on the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, ahead of Hollywood's buzzy awards season which culminates with that organization's monumental Oscars ceremony each spring.

Her first Tweet posed the question, 'Is anybody else excited to watch the same 12 people get nominated for oscars this year?'

Outspoken: Evan Rachel Wood, actress of Westworld and Thirteen fame, took to Twitter on Wednesday to express some of her views on the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

Wood, 32, went on to comment on various aspects of the increasingly criticized film organization, which in recent past has been accused of racial biases (at least two #oscarssowhite campaigns have unfolded) as well as the often political, and now evidently money-driven, practice of tirelessly campaigning for a trophy instead of winning one on pure (but subjective) merit.

Evan's sentiment hit a chord in the Twitter-verse, getting followers to comment and agree or disagree with her.

One user mentioned her hope for new up-and-coming actress Cynthia Erivo to get recognition this year, presumably for her role of Harriet Tubman in the film Harriet, to which Wood responded, 'Well this would be refreshing wouldn’t it.'

She continued, 'I mean.. I am in the Academy now. Although after that last tweet they may kick me out. Haha.'

Her first Tweet posed the question: 'Is anybody else excited to watch the same 12 people get nominated for oscars this year?'

Second thoughts: Evan's sentiment hit a chord in the Twitter-verse, but she soon began hedging

It was at that point that the Across The Universe star walked back some of her comments a bit, apparently hoping to soften her tone:

'This is not to throw shade at the Academy or the films,' she began.

'BUT if we got BIG MONEY out of campaigning, (just like elections) then maybe it would be fair? Just a thought.'

Changing her tone: It was at that point that the Across The Universe star walked back some of her comments a bit, apparently hoping to soften her tone

The came her mea culpa, when she jokingly tweeted, 'Also lets just go ahead and assume I am never getting nominated now.'

Ironically, Evan stands to eventually get a nod, as she is an undeniably talented actress who has already been repeatedly nominated for both Primetime Emmys and Golden Globes.

She then widened her criticism to target the industry as a whole: 'Also, not blaming it all on the Academy. The industry will only cast Actors that get the movies ‘Financed’ and it becomes a very small pool very quickly.'

Mea culpa: Evan jokingly tweeted about never getting nominated, which hopefully won't be the case

Wood ended the minor 'rant' on a note concerning female directors, tweeting that 'They arent getting nominated because no one is financing their films.'

To date, only one female director has won a Best Director Oscar: Kathryn Bigelow, for 2009's The Hurt Locker.

Apart from her ongoing work on HBO's robot western series Westworld, Evan has several projects in the pike, including a voice in Disney's new Frozen II and a lead role opposite Debra Winger in the heist movie Kajillionaire.

Don't mess with this robot: Wood is still involved in ongoing work on HBO's western sci fi series Westworld
